intro: Cerastium stenopetalum, commonly known as the narrow-petaled mouse-ear, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant features small, white flowers that bloom in early summer, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically hairy and arranged in a rosette pattern, adapted to withstand harsh alpine conditions. Cerastium stenopetalum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
